Type Library

Note

Types, Type Aliases, TypeVars, and NewTypes

Often, we need a particular class or type to make it semantically clear in our code that we are manipulating conceptual objects of a particular nature. But as often, native types and classes satisfy our technical needs. NewTypes constitute an efficient solution to this issue. (References: Stackoverflow question).

BinaryMatrix

A type alias for binary matrix

BinaryMatrixInput

A type alias for binary matrix flexible input parameters

BinaryValue

A NewType equivalent to \(\mathbb{B}\)

BinaryValueInput

A TypeVar that represent types commonly accepted as equivalent to BinaryValue

Functions

flatten(x)

Flatten an iterable object.
